debug_bridge.commands: reset stop load ioloop reqloop start wait
debug_bridge.gdb_commands: reset stop load ioloop reqloop start gdb wait

status.desc: Return the current status of the FLL

actual_mult.name: Actual multiplication factor.
actual_mult.desc: Returns the current multiplication factor (i.e., current frequency), which is measured out of the DCO at each clock ref cycle.

mult_factor.name: Target clock multiplication factor for normal mode.
mult_factor.desc: When using normal mode, this sets the target multiplication factor, i.e. the one that the feedback will try to reach by tuning the DCO input code.

dco_input.name: DCO input code for stand-alone mode.
dco_input.desc: When using the stand-alone mode, this sets the DCO input code, i.e. this sets the output frequency of the DCO. See the transfer function to get more details about the relationship between output frequency and DCO input code.

div.name: FLL output clock divider setting.
div.desc: This sets the divider between the FLL output frequency and the DCO output frequency. 0 means no division.

lock_en.name: FLL output gated by LOCK signal (active high)
lock_en.desc: When active, the FLL is producing the output clock signal only if the produced frequency is within the lock tolerance.

mode.name: Operation mode select (0=stand-alone, 1=normal).
mode.desc: The normal mode is using a feedback loop to reach the requested frequency while the stand-alone mode is directly using the output of the DCO to get a frequency proportional to the given DCO input code.

gain.name: FLL loop gain setting (default: 2^-8 = 1/256).
gain.desc: When using normal mode, this defines the gain applied to the difference between the specified multiplication factor and the actual one, before it is provided to the loop filter.

deassert_cycles.name: De-assert cycles
deassert_cycles.desc: In normal mode, this gives the number of unstable ref-clock cycles (i.e. out of the tolerance) until the lock is de-asserted. In stand-alone mode, this gives the lower 6-bit of the LOCK assert counter target, after which the FLL starts producing a clock.

assert_cycles.name: Assert cycles
assert_cycles.desc: In normal mode, this gives the number of stable ref-clock cycles (i.e. within the tolerance) after which the lock is asserted. In stand-alone mode, this gives the upper 6-bit of LOCK assert counter target, after which the FLL starts producing a clock.

tolerance.name: Lock tolerance
tolerance.desc: this gives the margin around the target multiplication factor within which the output clock is considered stable.

sta_clock.name: Config clock select in STA mode (0=DCOCLK, 1=REFCLK).
sta_clock.desc: In stand-alone mode, this specifies the clock driving the configuration registers (either ref-clock or DCO clock).

open_lock.name: Open-loop-when-locked (active high).
open_lock.desc: This switched to open loop mode when the output frequency is within the tolerance.

dithering.name: Dithering enable (active high).
dithering.desc: Applies dither filter to the DCO input code to get one moe bit and improve the precision using noise generation.

state_fract.name: Integrator state: fractional part (dither unit input)
state_fract.desc: This gives the fractional part of the integrator unit output used to compute the DCO input code. This corresponds to the input given to the dither unit.

state_int.name: Integrator state: integer part (DCO input bits)
state_int.desc: This gives the integer part of the integrator unit output used to compute the DCO input code. This corresponds to the DCO input code before it is rounded with the dither unit output.

saddr.desc:
Configure pointer to memory buffer:
  - Read: value of the pointer until transfer is over. Else returns 0
  - Write: set Address Pointer to memory buffer start address

size.desc:
Buffer size in DATASIZE. (128kBytes maximum)
  - Read: buffer size left
  - Write: set buffer size

continuous.desc:
Channel continuous mode:
  -1'b0: disable
  -1'b1: enable
At the end of the buffer the uDMA reloads the address and size and starts a new transfer.

datasize.desc:
Channel transfer size used to increment uDMA buffer address pointer:
  - 2'b00: +1 (8 bits)
  - 2'b01: +2 (16 bits)
  - 2'b10: +4 (32 bits)
  - 2'b11: +0

en.desc:
Channel enable and start transfer:
  -1'b0: disable
  -1'b1: enable
This signal is used also to queue a transfer if one is already ongoing.

clr.desc:
Channel clear and stop transfer:
  -1'b0: disable
  -1'b1: enable

pending.desc:
Transfer pending in queue status flag:
  -1'b0: free
  -1'b1: pending

SPI_CMD_CFG.desc: Sets the configuration for the SPI Master IP

SPI_CMD.desc: Select the SPIM command to be processed. Here CFG

CS.desc:
Sets the Chip Select (CS):
  - 2'b00: select csn0
  - 2'b01: select csn1
  - 2'b10: select csn2
  - 2'b11: select csn3

SPI_CMD.desc: Select the SPIM command to be processed. Here SOT

CMD_VALUE.desc: Sets the command to send. MSB must always be at bit15 also if cmd size is lower than 16

CMD_SIZE.desc: Size in bits of the command to send. The value written here is num bits - 1.

SPI_CMD.desc: Select the SPIM command to be processed. Here SEND_CMD

CMD_SIZE.desc: Size in bits of the address to send. The value written here is num bits - 1.

SPI_CMD.desc: Select the SPIM command to be processed. Here SEND_ADDR

DUMMY_CYCLE.desc: Number of dummy cycles to perform

SPI_CMD.desc: Select the SPIM command to be processed. Here DUMMY

SPI_CMD_WAIT.desc: Waits an external event to move to the next instruction

SPI_CMD.desc: Select the SPIM command to be processed. Here WAIT

DATA_SIZE.desc: Number of bits to send (Max 64Kbits). The value written here is num bits - 1.

BYTE_ALIGN.desc:
Disable byte alignment
  - 1'b0: enable byte alignment
  - 1'b1: disable byte alignment

SPI_CMD.desc: Select the SPIM command to be processed. Here TX_DATA

DATA_SIZE.desc: Number of bits to receive (Max 64Kbits). The value written here is num bits - 1.

BYTE_ALIGN.desc:
Disable byte alignment
  - 1'b0: enable byte alignment
  - 1'b1: disable byte alignment

SPI_CMD.desc: Select the SPIM command to be processed. Here RX_DATA

SPI_CMD_RPT.desc: Repeat the next transfer N times

SPI_CMD.desc: Select the SPIM command to be processed. Here RPT
Select the SPIM command to be processed. Here EOT

SPI_CMD_RPT_END.desc: End of the repeat loop command

SPI_CMD.desc: Select the SPIM command to be processed. Here RPT_END

SPI_CMD_RX_CHECK.desc: Check up ot 16 bits of data against an expected value

STATUS_SIZE.desc: Size in bits of the word to read. The value written here is num bits - 1.

CHECK_TYPE.desc:
Select check to process:
  - 2'b00: compare bit a bit
  - 2'b01: compare only ones
  - 2'b10: compare ony zeros

BYTE_ALIGN.desc:
Disable byte alignment
  - 1'b0: enable byte alignment
  - 1'b1: disable byte alignment

SPI_CMD.desc: Select the SPIM command to be processed. Here RX_CHECK

DATA_SIZE.desc: Number of bits to send (Max 64Kbits). The value written here is num bits - 1.

BYTE_ALIGN.desc:
Disable byte alignment
  - 1'b0: enable byte alignment
  - 1'b1: disable byte alignment

SPI_CMD.desc: Select the SPIM command to be processed. Here FULL_DUPLEX

help.py-stack: Display the full python stack in case an exception is caught
